textContent:
---brainrot---

I already told you but, I really had a hard time writing more letters because I couldn't help but always think about you and our date today for the past few days. Jesus Christ. I miss you so much Rei that I'm suffering from brainrot. Tapon utak na talaga hahaha. I like the feeling though. I'm always happy when I think about you, when I look at pictures of us. I can't wait to meet you later!!

---january---

Okay, I really think the month of January deserves its own entry so here it is. January was long. I couldn't see it before. But I could see it now. I couldn't see it because I was so focused on you (which is a good thing). It's like January was a cycle of wanting to see you, seeing you, then wanting to see you again. Which made everything feel to fast. Because the moment's we have together, however many hours they may be, all fly so fast because of how much I enjoy them. 

But, at the same time, upon reflecting on it, we've learned a lot about each other. In just a span of one month. Which is why it felt so really long. 

I've learned about your hobbies (bts, reading, rotting in bed, nails, etc.). 

I've memorized your average in the board exams (87.6, mas mataas pa don sa topnotcher nung 2019). 

I've learned about your "grado sa mata" (di ko alam english okay. Pero 70-170 yan. tas near-sighted ka pero may astigmatism ka ren).

I've learned about your very useful skill to always be sleepy.

I've learned how much you like reading about tragic love stories.

Just as January was fast because it was a cycle of wanting to see you, seeing you and wanting to see you again, January was also slow because it was a cycle of learning things about you, liking you more because of it, then learning more things about you again. May we experience the entirety of our futures together, Rei.
title: February 2, 2024

---brainrot---


I already told you but, I really had a hard time writing more letters because I couldn't help but always think about you and our date today for the past few days. Jesus Christ. Which made everything feel to fast. Because the moment's we have together, however many hours they may be, all fly so fast because of how much I enjoy them. 


But, at the same time, upon reflecting on it, we've learned a lot about each other. In just a span of one month. Which is why it felt so really long. 


I've learned about your hobbies (bts, reading, rotting in bed, nails, etc.).

I've learned about your "grado sa mata" (di ko alam english okay. Pero 70-170 yan. tas near-sighted ka pero may astigmatism ka ren).


I've learned about your very useful skill to always be sleepy.


I've learned how much you like reading about tragic love stories.


Just as January was fast because it was a cycle of wanting to see you, seeing you and wanting to see you again, January was also slow because it was a cycle of learning things about you, liking you more because of it, then learning more things about you again. May we experience the entirety of our futures together, Rei.
